reviewText: It's a bit older so the graphics are nothing to write home about, but holy moly if you're looking for an isometric Smash-TV style slaughterfest this is hard to beat. Insane enemy count on screen, tons of secrets to find, destruction abounds. Only weak points really are the guns are completely linear, as in more $$ = better, but otherwise a complete blast for ~5 hours or so.

reviewText:
An old school shooter that has a top-down / isometric perspective, similar to the one that characterises many hack 'n' slash RPGs. But Alien Shooter is not an RPG. It's all about the mindless action. Notice the adjective mindless! You press down your left mouse button and you do not stop until all aliens are dead. At the same time, of course, you try to get away from the smaller creatures and avoid the projectiles of the bigger ones.

Although the game has some RPG elements (you can visit stores regularly and there's levelling up) main emphasis is on the action. It's a shame that SIGMA made this game very short and that they recycled most of the elements in the game that later became known as Zombie Shooter part 1 and part 2. I assume the game's next installment, Conscription, looks and plays exactly like this one so I did not bother purchasing it.

Still, you can pick up this one or one of the Zombie Shooter versions and have a couple of hours of fun when SIGMA games are on sale.

reviewText:
Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded is the follow up to Alien Shooter. Much like its predecessor, you spend the game shooting lots and lots of aliens. It improves on the original in many ways, and in the process becomes a game that can become worthy of some of your time.

The graphics have seen a marked improvement in AS2. Everything looks crisper, there's more details to the characters and environments, and the aliens are varied and unique. The shooting is also much improved, with aiming being much tighter. The movement controls are as crisp as the original. You will be spending a lot of time dancing around with WASD and holding the left mouse button, so get used to that.

AS2 has some RPG lite elements. You earn experience through your actions, and can level up in about 6 categories. I am not quite sure how a high intelligence would help you in this game, but it is one of the categories. You also spend your cash on weapon upgrades to help your hunting a little easier.

Alien Shooter 2 has voice acting that is serviceable, and the music adds a nice touch much like the original.

Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded can be recommended for the improvements that were made over its predecessor. All of the major flaws were addressed, with better controls, graphics and enemy variety. If you are looking for a mindless shooter than this game is worthy of a try.

Grade: C+

reviewText:
Aliens Shooter 2: Reloaded is a game that throws hordes and hordes of enemies at the player until every inch of the level is covered in their blood and entrails. The developer clearly wanted to make a game that has constant action and they achieved that. This game barely has a moment without combat, which I like as sometimes it is nice to play a game that is just crazy gameplay. The player will constantly be backpedaling as they shoot the endless waves of aliens, somewhat like Smash TV.

When the player kills a significant number of enemies, they level up and are given 5 skill points per level to improve the character's stats. For example, the player can upgrade their 'accuracy' stat which dictates how much damage the player will do. The player can also improve their health, strength, speed, intelligence and a 'special' skill such as health regeneration. The player can also manage an inventory and buy items from a shop located in every level. The aforementioned features are the RPG elements of this game - very light RPG elements I might add. If you're looking for a game with deep stat customization or indepth weapon info, you'll be disappointed with this game. I think the RPG elements in this game are perfect for an arcade shooter such as this one.

The story is simple: evil corporation delves into the unknown and brings forth human killing aliens. Your job is to investigate what happened and eradicate all alien life, discreetly of course. Weyland Yu- excuse me, M.A.G.M.A. corp will be the majority of the locations you visit. Labs, armories and sewers.
The voice acting is pretty bad and gives off a 'cheap' vibe but I believe it is forgivable considering the main point of the game is to blast aliens to smithereens and the developers are a very small team of Russians.

The music is good! They advertise it as dynamic but this basically means that the game will begin playing 'action' music during battles and atmospheric music during non-combat sections. The action music is catchy and nice to blast aliens to, while the atmospheric music is even better and as it is actually creepy and gives off a horror vibe. The player will hear distant roars, buzzing and generally the noises of dread. Love it.

Graphics are not bad but obviously not good either. What annoyed me is the fact that the game doesn't include a 1920 x 1080 resolution, which is strange considering it was developed in 2007. So expect aliased graphics. Besides that, the enviroments do look good. The labs are realistic but appear fictional at the same time, the alien design is reminiscent of aliens from other works of fiction but overall I liked it. The gore is fantastic and it will never get old blowing a hole in an alien's stomach.

The game isn't very long, only about 5 hours on normal difficulty but the player can lengthen this by playing on a harder difficulty. There is two submodes called Stand Firm and Gun Stand but only Gun Stand is worth playing. Basically you defend a spot against alien waves and upgrade your turret. I recommend this game if you enjoy games like Smash TV or arcade shooters.

6/10

reviewText: Alien Shooter is badass, ALL Alien Shooter games. I've played some of the Alien Shooter games when i was a kid, i got so inspired by them, that i painted a lot of my own guns and gear. That's middle school for ya :). Sigma Team either brainwashes you or inspires you, and that's final. Sigma is working on Alien Shooter 3 behind the scenes, but it's on a freeze (game development pause). hope for the best, my brethren! :D. Regarding if i recommend this game? YES MOST CERTAINLY!, get it if you love lots of guns and gear and love shooting aliens. Play on IMPOSSIBLE, it's a challenge!, and do not get trapped in a corner by the aliens, they will shred you to pieces.

reviewText: If you like the Diablo series, you will like this game. It's a crunchy throwback to all those old 90's action-RPG's that let you kill thousands of enemies with various weapons and abilities.  The levels are large and packed with secret areas and special items. The guns feel powerful and it is fun and satisfying to kill the creatures as they swarm towards you. The story isn't fantastic but who cares? There's more than enough exploration, upgrades, and combat in this game to make up for that.\n\nIf you're looking for hours of mindless fun shooting hordes of monsters, This game is definitely worth the $5 price tag.

reviewText: Alien Shooter, one of my favorite games from my childhood. The game was released about 10 years ago. And yes, it has ugly graphics for today's standards, but it is actually so much fun playing this game. The game view takes place from an isometric angle and you control your character with the tasks of cleaning the laboratories. Just as its name implies, you shoot at aliens. There are a bunch of choices of weapons in the game. From small arms like handguns and shotguns, to ultimate weapons such as rocket launchers and framer. There are more than 1,000 monsters on each map, showing up to 100 monsters simultaneously on one playing screen. Blood is everywhere! Yay, Alien Shooter is a perfect game for you to satisfy your lust for blood.

reviewText:
8/10

The first Alien Shooter was already quite a good game. This sequel was even better.

It maintains the base gameplay of the original game - move around, aim with the mouse, shoot aliens. However, it also includes more things that make the game much more interesting. Attributes weigh quite heavily on gameplay, hence leveling up really does make a difference. The perks are quite interesting and varied.

The best of all is actually the variety of weapons. Even among weapons of the same type (shotguns, automatic weapons, etc), there's often a large difference as they vary heavily on damage, reload times, fire rate and accuracy. The game actually makes the player want to purchase new weapons and test them out against enemies - and some weapons are just crazy fun to use (the miniguns are a personal favorite of mine).

Bigger variety of enemies and the addition of vehicles are also considerable improvements.

Camera is still an issue. Just like its predecessor, camera angle is fixed and there's no transparency effect, meaning there are items and enemies that may be behind walls and the player won't be able to see these.

reviewText:
The controls are a bit clunky, the aim is a little off (both for you and the AI), and the voice-acting is barely par for the course...
But who cares? You can fire a minigun at legions of aliens like a total badass, wear a mech-suit that stops whatever comes its way, ride in a bunch of vehicles that'll make mince-meat out of anything that stands in their way... Wait, what?! A freaking tank?! Oh, look at the cannon blast. Holy mother of...
Alright, so this game is hardly perfect and more than a few things could use a touch-up. But like I said: Who cares? This game will make you feel more badass than any other game since Doom. And most importantly, it's fun! So many games today go their way to immerse you in the experience, only to forget the fundamental idea of fun.
Alien Shooter 2, and its predecessor to some extent, are among the most thrilling games I've played for a long time. They've existed since I was nine, and it awakens that 9-year old inside of me like little else. I have nothing more to say! Go play the damn game! It's great!

reviewText:
Fun game.
Its a isometric run and gun shooter with extreme gore.

The game looks are pretty simple and all the monster are pixel based. The good part about that is that you dont need a good computer to render many enemies, you can have several predefined death animations and bodies stay on ground until the level ends. So if you if you go into a clean environment and kill a 100 aliens there, its going to look like a mess...

Light RPG elements, lots of weapons to choose from, static guns, car guns and tanks. I had fun playing this game. Just remember to go into AlienShooter.cfg to turn vsync off (performance issues, not a ingame option) and change to a slightly better resolution, i used 1440x900 on a 24."

reviewText:
Alien Shooter 2 actually manages to be the best game I've ever played from Sigma Team. Not that that's saying much, they make some truly dreadful games. But it is still on the higher end of the mediocrity scale where they usually hang dangerously close to the truly abysmal end. They fixed the length of the game and gave it some proper RPG progression mechanics as well as a secrets system to encourage obsessive compulsive disorder. It is better than Zombie Shooter 2, more refined but it is still just another Sigma Team money grab.

If you got it from the Indie Gala bundle then enjoy it for the few hours you can. If you bought it full price then you're an idiot and should not procreate.

Also, it might be worth to try it, just for the voice acting which is truly in a league of it's own. It is actually so low on the scale it becomes a negative and in a weird way that actually makes it worth listening to just to be able to say you've done it.

reviewText: I got this quadrilogy on special for 5bux a while ago and this game is the best of them. voila

reviewText: I wasn't sure what I could expect from Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded. I mean, I spend really many hours playing the first Alien Shooter game - more than 10 years ago when it was added in certain gaming magazine in my country and not so long ago when I get my copy on Steam. So, here I am, after finishing this game. It looks same. It's same gameplay. You could say, the time stopped for this one, even if it was released around 6 years after first game... BUT, there is something that, even tho it's feels old and nostalgic, gives something refreshing. New aliens, new variety of weapons, new level up system, new vehicles, new shooting mode. Yes, a good old game that was improved on so many levels. You can complain about story, about voices or dunno what more BUT that doesn't change one fact - it's still solid and great fun game when it comes to gameplay.\nIf you ever loved first Alien Shooter game, you must play it. Not sure if new players would be pleased with this kind of games in times when, sadly, games are focusing on everything but not on pure fun of playing. I know I will replay it at once when I will feel hunger for some intense action and simply fun of killing tons of aliens.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Bigger and better Alien Shooter game. This is a huge improvement from part 1 of the series as we have lots of new stuff here, including:
- different categories of weapons
- levelling system where we actually allocate points in a simple system
- we can choose perk at the beginning
- plot is simple but ok

Be warned though - this is not as brainless shooter as part 1. This is a pretty long game when we consider the genre. Where part 1 was mass shooter, here we have more of a linear plot-driven shooter with lots of enemies.

If you like Alien Shooter 1 then you can play this one too. If you would like a quick session of alien killing go fo Theseus Return of the Hero instead.

Pros:
- lots of secrets (like 17 for one level!)
- lite sci-fi plot
- lots of weapons
- levelling system is ok
- even pistols are useful
- you can drive a car and control a robot later in the game
- graphics are quite ok for such a game and may resemble some older rpgs

Cons:
- it's really long for an isometric shooter
- some levels are overly big
- it can get repetitive pretty fast, as you could have guessed - there are parts where it is best to stand still and fry aliens for about 2 minutes
- not really hard if you don't rush your way into alien horde

If you feel that Sigma Team shooters are fine then play this one as well. It's really ok.

----------
For anyone interested in joining in on completing your own backlog; check it out here - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog/discussions/5/530645446320364338/

reviewText:
the alien shooter games are none of that pseudo retro cr4p you get everywhere today. these games actually ARE retro!

but take a look at the screenshots first. if they make you want to hurl then this kind of game certainly isn't made for you.
if you don't mind the old graphics or maybe even like them then you're in for a good time!

of course there is some kind of story going on but as you can imagine it's all about splattering aliens all over the place with really big a$$ guns.
as you can see the graphics aren't exactly top-notch but i feel like they fit nicely into the whole old-school setting of these games.
you gain xp, level up and distribute your attribute points pretty much rpg-like as you see fit. you loot the environment to get your hands on ammo and new items as well as collect money to buy yourself some decent gear and new shiny boomsticks at the trader.
the map design is quite decent and there are even a lot of secret areas to be found.

pretty straight forward gameplay but surprisingly big fun and entertaining.
grab the whole package on sale or in a bundle and start mowing down the alien scum!
